text:
Hi all!

Time to share some important information with you!

IN GENERAL
With the Awesome Foundation Rotterdam, a group of Rotterdam citizens wants to help other people with great ideas that benefit the city or its citizens. We give away a €1.000 to the most awesome idea, but are eager to help EVERYONE by connecting them with our broad network.

PROGRAM
Here is the program for Thursday 29 July:

18-20 hr: food and drinks
20-22 hr: pitches and announcement winner

LOCATION
Location: De Maaskantine (in the Esch)
Please be there around 18hr so we can do the last checks with you all.

INVITE YOUR FRIENDS
20 trustees will vote for the winner, and there's one important vote for the audience. So invite all your friends and colleagues and let them get a free ticket via <https://awesomerotterdam.sub.link/pitchnight24>

LIVESTREAM
We will do a livestream for the ones at home. Check out our website for the stream.

Questions? Let us know!

Team awesome

attachments.title: Awesome Foundation Rotterdam - Pitch Night 24
attachments.text: We make Rotterdam (more) awesome. We award the most awesome idea with €1.000 and help you realize it.
attachments.fallback: Eventbrite: Awesome Foundation Rotterdam - Pitch Night 24

elements.text:
Hi all!

Time to share some important information with you!

IN GENERAL
With the Awesome Foundation Rotterdam, a group of Rotterdam citizens wants to help other people with great ideas that benefit the city or its citizens. We give away a €1.000 to the most awesome idea, but are eager to help EVERYONE by connecting them with our broad network.

PROGRAM
Here is the program for Thursday 29 July:

18-20 hr: food and drinks
20-22 hr: pitches and announcement winner

LOCATION
Location: De Maaskantine (in the Esch)
Please be there around 18hr so we can do the last checks with you all.

INVITE YOUR FRIENDS
20 trustees will vote for the winner, and there's one important vote for the audience. So invite all your friends and colleagues and let them get a free ticket via

LIVESTREAM
We will do a livestream for the ones at home. Check out our website for the stream.

Questions? Let us know!

Team awesome

text: There are established methods for assessing individual and group level factors of the team, but practitioners have little tools for observing the dynamics of startup found- ing teams. Studies have shown that team dynamics dictate team performance more than individual capabilities, and thus a more accurate assessment of shared leadership, constructive conflict and psychological safety would be highly valuable. - Valtter Vihervuori

elements.text: There are established methods for assessing individual and group level factors of the team, but practitioners have little tools for observing the dynamics of startup found- ing teams. Studies have shown that team dynamics dictate team performance more than individual capabilities, and thus a more accurate assessment of shared leadership, constructive conflict and psychological safety would be highly valuable. - Valtter Vihervuori

text: <https://www.linkedin.com/in/eva-de-mol-ph-d-5a560016>

“Surprisingly, the entrepreneurship literature is not very mature in terms of exploring these team-level antecedents. More specifically, our review did not include a single study devoted to the sole examination of the antecedents of entrepreneurial team cognition. “

elements.text: “Surprisingly, the entrepreneurship literature is not very mature in terms of exploring these team-level antecedents. More specifically, our review did not include a single study devoted to the sole examination of the antecedents of entrepreneurial team cognition. “

text: “_Entrepreneurial team cognition is an emergent state that refers to the manner in which knowledge is mentally organized, represented and distributed within the team and allows entrepreneurial team members to approach problem-solving and make assessments, judgments or decisions concerned with milestones and outcomes relevant to the entrepreneurial process, such as identifying and evaluating different opportunities, or defining and implementing launch and growth strategies.”_

elements.text: Entrepreneurial team cognition is an emergent state that refers to the manner in which knowledge is mentally organized, represented and distributed within the team and allows entrepreneurial team members to approach problem-solving and make assessments, judgments or decisions concerned with milestones and outcomes relevant to the entrepreneurial process, such as identifying and evaluating different opportunities, or defining and implementing launch and growth strategies.”

attachments.title: re:Work - Creating A High-Trust, High-Performance Culture
attachments.text: Building a culture of trust can be a powerful way to improve performance. Neuroscientific research shows that trust reduces social frictions and promotes cooperative behavior among colleagues — and that managers can create high-trust, high-performance teams.

text:
<@U01RV12B4A1> <@U0273KZ3668> Just picked Ohad’s brain to figure out the requirements of a good ask. He came up with the following points (more or less in order of importance):

1 The ask needs to have serious *impact* for the future of the company
    a. motivation
    b. outcomes
2 It needs to be honest and you have to show your *weaknesses*
    a. No sugar coating
    b. worst thing is those asks that are hidden self-compliments
3 It needs to be *specific* and *measurable* i.e. quantifiable (for instance, not _I need leads_ but _I need 3 leads)_
4 It needs to have a clear *owner* i.e. team member who is responsible to follow through

<@U0273KZ3668> This article frames the problem that you describe very well.

My idea would be to have *machine curation*, but the paradox is that in order to be able to do that we need less *human curation* to acquire the necessary data

attachments.title: Slack Is the Right Tool for the Wrong Way to Work
attachments.text: If Slack, which improves a fundamentally flawed approach to collaboration, is worth tens of billions of dollars, imagine the value in fixing the underlying problems.
attachments.fallback: The New Yorker: Slack Is the Right Tool for the Wrong Way to Work
